item.title: Difference between wait and sleep in java
item.description: Introduction In this post, we will discuss the difference between wait() and sleep() methods in java. And discuss how to use these two methods. Difference between wait and sleep wait() is a native method defined in Object. 1 public final native void wait(long timeout) throws InterruptedException; So every instance of the class can call this method. wait() can only be called in a synchronized block. It will release the lock put on the object when it is synchronized.
